text:
In my .bashrc I have defined the following environment variable:

export ANT_ARGS="-file /mydir/build.xml"

This allows me to run "ant foo-target" in any subfolder of my project. However, complete-ant-cmd.pl only suggests the possible targets when I am in the folder containing build.xml.

The completion script should not only look for -f/-file/-buildfile in arguments previously typed on the command line but also in the $ANT_ARGS environment variable.
creator: issues.apache.org@chsc.dk

Created attachment 32308
Add support for $ANT_ARGS and the -file argument alias

Created attachment 32317
Add support for $ANT_ARGS and the -file argument alias, v2

Updated version: If -buildfile/file/f argument appears both in ANT_ARGS and on the command line, the command line argument wins.

Also, if the same argument is specified twice on the command line, the last argument wins (follows current Ant behaviour).
